good evening: Buffer I/O error on device dm-4, logical block 6292943
you can try turning off dma, or slowing it down.
you can try disabling dma during the install
what were you doing when you get that error?
possibly you have an intermittent problem with your memory.  I've seen machines run for months between errors of that type.
I'd run the memtest86 (assuming you are on x86 architecture)
memtest86 is a separate, stand alone memory tester that is independent of linux or windows.
it is very good at finding intermittent memory problems.
if you install ubuntu, memtest86 is also installed and added to your boot menu.  Is it on the live cd boot menu?  I'm not sure.
